definition[0]: to persuade someone to do or give you something, for example by saying nice things to them that you do not mean – used to show disapproval
example[0]: She even managed to wheedle more money out of him.
example[1]: You have to be able to wheedle your client into buying.
example[2]: Don’t think you can just wheedle your way in here!
note[2]: wheedle your way in/into/out of etc
